command-builder.title: Command Builder
command-builder.description: Build Capacitor CLI commands by dragging parts in the correct order
command-builder.instructions: Drag and drop command parts in the correct order to complete each challenge.

challenges.instruction: Create a new Capacitor project named "my-app"
challenges.description: Use the npx command to initialize a project
challenges.hint: The base command is npx @capacitor/cli create

challenges.instruction: Add the Android platform to the project
challenges.description: Use npm to install the native platform
challenges.hint: Use npm install to add dependencies

challenges.instruction: Sync the web project with native platforms
challenges.description: Copy web assets and update plugins
challenges.hint: cap sync is the command to synchronize

challenges.instruction: Open the Android project in Android Studio
challenges.description: Launch the native IDE for development
challenges.hint: Use cap open followed by the platform

challenges.instruction: Run the app on a connected Android device
challenges.description: Compile and run in development mode
challenges.hint: cap run with --target device runs on a physical device

plugin-matcher.title: Plugin Matcher
plugin-matcher.description: Connect each use case with the correct Capacitor plugin
plugin-matcher.instructions: Match each use case with the plugin that solves it. Use hints if you need help.

pairs.useCase: Show Face ID or fingerprint for authentication
Send push notifications to the device
Show a splash screen while the app loads
Change the device status bar color
pairs.hint: Control of the system top bar

pairs.useCase: Detect when the virtual keyboard shows or hides
Open a URL in the system browser
Get information about the device and app

build-pipeline.title: Build Pipeline
build-pipeline.description: Order the build process steps for Android and iOS
build-pipeline.instructions: Drag steps in the correct order to complete the build pipeline.

store-reviewer.title: Store Reviewer
store-reviewer.description: Identify issues that would cause an app rejection
store-reviewer.instructions: Read each scenario and select the issues that could cause a rejection in the stores.

scenarios.title: Finance App - Play Store Rejection
scenarios.description: Your banking app was rejected. Review the following items and mark those that could cause the rejection.
issues: Missing privacy policy in the app
Does not declare use of financial data
scenarios.explanation: Financial apps require privacy policy, permission justification, and sensitive data declaration.

scenarios.title: Social App - App Store Rejection
scenarios.description: Your social network was rejected by Apple. Identify the problems.
issues: Sign in with Apple not implemented
scenarios.explanation: Apple requires: option to delete account, Sign in with Apple if there's social login, and UGC moderation.

scenarios.title: Health App - Compliance
scenarios.description: You're preparing a health tracking app. What do you need before publishing?
issues: Notice that it doesn't replace medical advice
scenarios.explanation: Health apps need HIPAA/GDPR consent, encryption, and medical disclaimers.

scenarios.title: App with In-App Purchases - Configuration
scenarios.description: Your app has premium subscriptions. Verify the configuration.
scenarios.explanation: Stores require: restore purchases, clear terms, ToS, and localized prices for IAP.
